meanings.sent1: She is the freest person in our group.
meanings.sent2: The bird flew freest in the open sky.
meanings.sent3: The freest cat in the neighborhood always finds a sunny spot to nap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the freest melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The freest spirit among us danced barefoot in the rain.

meanings.definition: To make free or set at liberty.
meanings.sent1: He freest the bird from its cage every morning.
meanings.sent2: The key will freest you from your chains.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to freest himself from the ropes.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to freest his mind from doubt.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air will freest your mind from worries.

meanings.definition: To release from bondage or imprisonment.
meanings.sent1: The hero freest the prisoners from the evil king's dungeon.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to freest the innocent man.
meanings.sent3: The key to the treasure chest will freest the valuable jewels.
meanings.sent4: Her determination will freest her from any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture will freest his heart from bitterness.
